channel.title: Documentation :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Documentation refers to the written materials that accompany program code. Documentation plays multiple, and often critical roles. Broadly speaking, we split documentation into two categories based on the intended audience: User Documentation is meant for the end-users of the software Developer Documentation is meant for the developers of the software As you might expect, the goals for these two styles of documentation are very different. User documentation instructs the user on how to use the software.
